skill.name: happyflow-generator
skill.description: Automatically generate and execute Python test scripts from OpenAPI specifications and GraphQL schemas with enhanced features
skill.summary: Generate and execute Python API test scripts from OpenAPI and GraphQL specs with dependency-aware ordering
skill.author: Chaim12345

security_audit.summary: Evaluated 81 static findings from the automated scanner. The skill is a legitimate API testing automation tool. All command execution is for running generated test scripts with hardcoded arguments. Network access fetches API specifications and makes test requests as documented. Environment variable access is for configuration only. The critical heuristic finding combines expected behaviors for API testing tools and is not malicious.

medium_findings.title: Network access for API specification fetching
medium_findings.description: Uses requests.get to fetch OpenAPI and GraphQL specifications from URLs. This is expected and documented behavior for an API testing tool that needs to parse specifications from remote sources.

medium_findings.title: Subprocess execution for script running
medium_findings.description: Uses subprocess.run to execute generated Python test scripts. Arguments are hardcoded as ['python', script_path] where script_path comes from secure tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile. This is legitimate for test automation.

low_findings.title: Environment variable access for configuration
low_findings.description: Reads DETAILED_REPORT environment variable to enable verbose output mode. This is a standard configuration pattern with no credential access or security risk.

low_findings.title: Temporary file creation for script execution
low_findings.description: Creates temporary files to store generated scripts before execution using tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile. Files are properly cleaned up with os.unlink after execution. Standard pattern for test runners.

content.user_title: Generate API Test Scripts from OpenAPI Specifications
content.value_statement: Manually writing API tests for complex endpoints with dependencies is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically generates executable Python test scripts from OpenAPI or GraphQL specifications that run endpoints in the correct dependency order.
actual_capabilities: Parse OpenAPI 3.0+ and GraphQL specifications from URLs or files
Analyze endpoint dependencies and determine safe execution order
Generate complete Python test scripts with proper authentication handling
Execute generated scripts with automatic retry and error recovery
Support parallel execution of independent endpoints for faster testing
Validate responses against JSON Schema specifications
limitations: Cannot test APIs that require complex multi-step authentication flows beyond OAuth2 client credentials
Generated tests use simplified example data that may not cover all validation rules
Cannot handle websockets or real-time streaming APIs
Rate limiting handling is basic and may need customization for aggressive rate limits

use_cases.title: Quick API smoke testing
use_cases.description: Generate a quick smoke test suite for a new API by providing the OpenAPI specification URL. The skill creates a script that hits all endpoints in dependency order and reports any failures.
use_cases.target_user: API developers needing quick validation of new endpoints

use_cases.title: CI/CD integration test generation
use_cases.description: Generate a comprehensive test suite for integration testing in CI/CD pipelines. The skill produces a Python script that can be committed to the repository and run with pytest or as a standalone script.
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers setting up automated testing pipelines

use_cases.title: Third-party API testing
use_cases.description: Test third-party API integrations by providing their public OpenAPI specification. Verify that the API behaves as documented and catch breaking changes early.
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers verifying external API contracts

prompt_templates.title: Basic OpenAPI test generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the HappyFlow Generator skill to generate API tests for https://api.example.com/openapi.json with bearer token authentication. Generate a complete Python script that tests all endpoints in the correct order.
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple API test generation with bearer authentication

prompt_templates.title: GraphQL schema testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Use HappyFlow Generator to create test scripts for a GraphQL API at https://api.example.com/graphql. Include authentication and generate a script that verifies the schema works correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel execution testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate API tests with parallel execution enabled for the OpenAPI specification at {spec_url}. Use the dependency analysis to identify which endpoints can run concurrently. Include detailed reporting.
prompt_templates.scenario: Fast parallel API testing with detailed metrics

prompt_templates.title: Authenticated API with error recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a test script for the API at {spec_url} using OAuth2 client credentials with client_id={client_id}, client_secret={secret}, and token_url={token_url}. Enable automatic retry with 5 attempts and detailed reporting.
prompt_templates.scenario: OAuth2 authenticated API with retry logic

output_examples.input: Generate tests for https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/swagger.json with bearer token YOUR_TOKEN
output_examples.output: The skill generates a complete Python script with endpoint analysis showing 20 total endpoints. The script includes dependency ordering logic, authentication headers, and executes all API calls in the correct sequence. Output displays execution results with status codes and indicates which endpoints were tested successfully.

output_examples.input: Generate parallel tests with detailed reporting for https://api.example.com/openapi.json
output_examples.output: The skill analyzes 45 endpoints and identifies 8 parallel execution groups. The generated script shows an execution plan with 12 sequential steps for dependency-required endpoints and 33 steps organized into 8 parallel groups. Estimated execution time is 2-3 minutes with 5 workers.

best_practices: Always review generated scripts before running against production APIs to ensure test data is appropriate
Use separate API tokens for testing rather than production credentials to avoid unintended side effects
Set appropriate timeouts and retry counts based on the target API response times and rate limits
anti_patterns: Running generated tests directly on production APIs without reviewing the test data first
Using real user credentials for automated testing which could create unintended data or actions
Expecting the skill to understand business logic validation rules that are not in the OpenAPI specification

faq.question: What authentication methods does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports bearer tokens, API keys, Basic authentication, and OAuth2 client credentials. For other authentication types, you may need to manually add headers to the generated script.

faq.question: Can I use this with private API specifications?
faq.answer: Yes, you can provide authenticated URLs or local file paths to private specifications. The skill will use any provided credentials for fetching the specification file.

faq.question: How does dependency ordering work?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes path parameters and HTTP methods to determine which endpoints create data needed by others. It uses topological sorting to ensure creating endpoints run before endpoints that need their output.

faq.question: What happens if a test fails?
faq.answer: The skill attempts automatic fixes for common errors like missing fields or constraint violations. For complex failures, the script exits with a non-zero code and reports which step failed.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated test data?
faq.answer: Yes, you can modify the generated script to use custom test data. The skill generates example data from OpenAPI schemas, but you should replace sensitive or specific values as needed.

faq.question: Is this safe to run in CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the generated scripts are standalone Python files that can be committed to version control and run in any CI/CD environment with Python and requests library installed.
